item.title: Fraser Information
item.description: The Fraser information is $$ I_F(\theta) = \int g(X) \ln f(X;\theta) , \mathrm d X. $$ When comparing two models, $\theta_0$ and $\theta_1$, the information gain is $$ \propto (F(\theta_1) - F(\theta_0)). $$ The Fraser information is closed related to Fisher information Fisher Information Fisher information measures the second moment of the model sensitivity with respect to the parameters. , Shannon information, and Kullback information KL Divergence Kullback–Leibler divergence indicates the differences between two distributions 1. Fraser DAS. On Information in Statistics. aoms. 1965;36: 890–896. doi:10.1214/aoms/1177700061 ↩︎
